answers.answer: The hives may or may not be related to diabetes, but they are definitely an allergic reaction to something.  Has she seen an allergy doctor?Certainly other autoimmune conditions do go hand in hand with diabetes for many people.

question: My sister is type 1, has had it since she was 10 (she is 28 now). She has recently broken out in hives that come and go sporadically, on her face, neck, back and arms. She experienced this 2 years ago for 6 months, and the doctor could not come up w/any reason. She was not allergic to anything. However she said that it 'could' maybe, be the diabetes, as she had seen patients with hives that had other autoimmune diseases. Has anyone here ever had hives, that are a diabetic?? any tips or info welcome, thank you.
title: Can diabetes cause hives?
